intro: Hypolepis capitellum, commonly known as the club-moss fern, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen fern that typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance with its clustered, spore-bearing cones at the tips of its stems. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, forming a dense, mat-like structure. Hypolepis capitellum plays an important ecological role in forest understories by contributing to soil stability and providing habitat for small organisms.
